event.speaker: Slick Shola Akinrolie
event.title: Kotlin Abuja User Group
event.subject: Kotlin, The future of mobile development
event.description: Experience the power of the fastest growing programming language in the world. Learn mobile development with ease and get resources, tools, and latest updates on Kotlin, CodeLab Sessions, Free License, Full Mentorship and lots more.

event.speaker: Oskar Drozda
event.title: Grupa .NET Politechnika Poznańska
event.subject: Annotation Processing 101
event.description: Butterknife, Spring, Lombok, SQLDelight, Dagger... All of them are processing annotation, but how they do that? This talk will be an introduction to the magical world of annotation processing in JVM. Code will be in shiny and trendy Kotlin language, but if you write Java on your daily basis, you will feel like at home.

event.speaker: Antonio Leiva
event.title: EXFest
event.subject: Introducción a las corrutinas en Kotlin
event.description: Si las tareas en segundo plano, los cambios de hilo o la sincronización entre callbacks te hacen tener pesadillas nocturnas, ¡las corrutinas harán que vuelvas a dormir tranquilo! Paso a paso y de forma muy sencilla, veremos todos los conceptos necesarios para entender cómo funcionan y resolver un problema muy común.

event.speaker: Dmitriy Zaitsev
event.title: UAMobile 2019
event.subject: Idiomatic DI in Kotlin without frameworks
event.description: All current popular DI frameworks for Java use annotation processing during compilation and/or program execution. They work equally well for Kotlin, but have their drawbacks because they generate too much code and/or use reflexion, which negatively affects the compilation time of the application, its size and performance. In addition, their configuration is usually non-trivial for a large project. Kotlin went better way...

event.speaker: Oleksandr Yefremov
event.title: UAMobile 2019
event.subject: Multiplatform shared codebase with Kotlin/Native
event.description: If you want to share the code between Android and iOS but you don't feel like doing C++/JNI, React Native, Flutter, you must try Kotlin/Native! In this presentation we will see how Kotlin/Native is different and in some aspects superior, and how easy it becomes to develop, debug and maintain a common codebase with JetBrains tools and without sacrificing runtime performance.

event.speaker: Stefan Beyer
event.title: Output 2019
event.subject: Ist Kotlin das bessere Java?
event.description: Kotlin hat sich in den letzten Jahren sehr verbreitet. Die Sprache, die ursprünglich nur für die JVM gedacht war, compiliert inzwischen auch nach JavaScript und native, wird von Google offiziell für Android unterstützt und erfreut sich generell immer mehr Beliebtheit. In dem Kurzvortrag werden die Grundlagen der Sprache angeschnitten. Ein Vergleich mit Java zeigt spezielle Probleme auf, die in altbekannten Sprachen bestehen. Warum Kotlin immer beliebter wird und was damit möglich ist, zeigt ein kleiner Ausblick.

event.speaker: Oscar Salguero
event.title: New York Kotlin Meetup
event.subject: Android Things and Kotlin
event.description: In this talk, Oscar tells us about the latest and greatest about Kotlin released at Google I/O 2018 and about the development of Sentinel, the first home security robot powered by Android Things, and how hardware, software, coded in Kotlin of course!, Firebase and how the Google Cloud Platform integrates with Sentinel to "bring it to life".

event.speaker: Mohit Sarveiya
event.title: New York Kotlin Meetup
event.subject: Kotlin Multiplatform
event.description: A Kotlin multiplatform project allows you share code between different platforms. It takes a different approach to cross platform development than Xamarin and other frameworks. This talk will be about how to setup and build a multiplatform project. We will look at features of Kotlin multiplatform development through an example project. We will also look at the current limitations.

event.speaker: Michael Fazio
event.title: Indy.Code()
event.subject: Kotlin - Less Code, More Fun
event.description: tl;dr - Write less (but safer!) code in your Android apps or any JVM-based projects Ever work on an Android app and tire of all the boilerplate code? Or spend hours chasing down NullPointerExceptions in your Java app? Enter Kotlin, JetBrains' new(ish) free, open-source programming language that targets the JVM. This means you can use it everywhere you use Java, but with a modern, succinct syntax. For native Android developers, Kotlin is not only available, but it's now considered a first-class language. You're able to write an app completely with Kotlin, or switch over entire components, or even just change your models to Kotlin's data classes (which removes a TON of boilerplate code.) Oh, and for anyone using Java elsewhere, you can add in Kotlin code to your existing application. Kotlin is 100% interoperable with Java, meaning all your existing code/libraries/tests will work with any Kotlin code you write. Doing JavaScript development? Kotlin can be transpiled into ES5, and there are even libraries available to use React or Angular with Kotlin. C# dev working on any kind of Java project? You'll feel much more at home with Kotlin, given features like nullable types, properties (rather than getters/setters), and extension methods. We'll walk through Kotlin's features, check out the syntax, and even create a small Android application so you can see Kotlin in action.

event.speaker: Michael Fazio
event.title: GDG Toulouse
event.subject: Introduction to Kotlin coroutines
event.description: Since Kotlin 1.3 was released last October, coroutines are no longer experimental and have become a key feature for Kotlin programmers, which was largely promoted during KotlinConf 2018. In this talk, we will quickly compare coroutines to other options of asynchronous programming available in Kotlin and explore how to use them efficiently in your app.

event.speaker: Leandro Sobocinski
event.title: TDC 2019 | Florianópolis
event.subject: Using Kotlin Multiplatform in iFood
event.description: Kotlin is a programming language that grew a lot in the last few years. Currently it's the default language for new Android apps, but are you ready for the next steps? Kotlin multiplatform is growing a lot and, despite the beta status, it's already possible to share code between different platforms. In this talk I'll explain how it works, the libraries that are already compatible with different platforms and how we are using it in iFood.

event.speaker: Ryan Batchelder
event.title: Kotlin Office Hours
event.subject: Taking Kotlin Multiplatform to the Cloud, a Serverless Approach
event.description: Running Kotlin/JVM on serverless platforms typically means dealing with high memory usage and slower startup times, which means interpreted languages like JS and Python are typically more popular. Since Kotlin can target JS, we can actually write Kotlin code that runs on serverless Node runtimes to get the performance and memory benefits that runtime provides. Surprisingly, we can also use Kotlin/Native to target serverless platforms to combine the speed of native code with the simplicity of serverless operations. I’ll talk about how to use both of these approaches to build cheaper, more performant serverless applications and how you might choose between them.

event.speaker: Alexander Nevyantsev
event.title: Rostov Kotlin User Group
event.subject: Kotlin codestyle
event.description: Котлин — это ящик Пандоры. Язык позволяет многое, но если искусственно не ограничивать себя, то программа может превратиться в хаос.

event.speaker: Mikhail Levchenko
event.title: Rostov Kotlin User Group
event.subject: Система типов в Kotlin
event.description: Что возвращает функция, когда бросает ошибку? Unit — это все таки void или Void? Можно ли сделать List? Как не сойти с ума и натянуть свою доменную область на типы?

event.speaker: Denis Alexandrov
event.title: Rostov Kotlin User Group
event.subject: Зачем нужны корутины
event.description: Корутины — мощный и широкий инструмент для решения задач по асинхронной обработке данных. Нужны ли корутины в маленьких проектах, какие проблемы они помогут решить и как добавить их в уже существующий проект?

event.speaker: Ruda Balázs
event.title: Kotlin Budapest User Group
event.subject: Static Code Analysis for Kotlin
event.description: This talk is about tools we can use for checking our Kotlin code: ktlint, detekt, and Android Lint. We'll cover how to integrate them to CI and IDE, how to write custom rules, and how test them.

event.speaker: Monori Antal János
event.title: Kotlin Budapest User Group
event.subject: Cleaning up your code with sealed classes
event.description: Also known more broadly as Algebraic Data Types, they represent a constrained class hierarchy with only one possible type at the time which helps you remain compiler-safe. Sealed classes in our data layer allow semantically more correct and type-safe code in our streams. He will go through how are they constructed and some real use cases to take away with you home.

event.speaker: Braun Márton
event.title: Kotlin Budapest User Group
event.subject: Cleaning up your code with sealed classes
event.description: A look at the important design choices to be made when designing a Kotlin library based on delegates.

event.speaker: Thomas Jaussoin
event.title: Meetup GDG Alps #4
event.subject: Kids: comment commencer à coder pour les plus de 8 ans

event.speaker: Justin Lee
event.title: VoxxedDays Minsk
event.subject: Undercover Kotlin: Using Kotlin without tipping your hand
event.description: One of the many hazards of trying out a new language is the lack of interoperability. A new language often presents the added burden of learning a whole new ecosystem. The designers of Kotlin took special care to make sure Kotlin suffered from this as little as possible. Generally speaking, much of the code written in Kotlin can be consumed from Java programs in complete ignorance. In some cases, we need to provide a little extra help. In this talk we’ll cover how to manage Kotlin/Java interop to make your Kotlin code as seamlessly usable from Java as possible.

event.speaker: Nikita Koval
event.title: VoxxedDays Minsk
event.subject: How we developed channel algorithms in Kotlin coroutines
event.description:
Most programming languages have been introducing asynchronous programming mechanisms. Kotlin, for its part, implemented coroutines which use channels to communicate with each other. Therefore, high-load applications depend on those channels performance, so they need to be implemented in an efficient and scalable way.

In this talk, we will discuss channel algorithms in other programming languages, how we in Kotlin developed our solution, which challenges and subtle aspects we encountered during this process, and whether we managed a real improvement of the existing solutions.

event.speaker: Sergey Zolotov
event.title: VoxxedDays Minsk
event.subject: How we developed channel algorithms in Kotlin coroutines
event.description: Kotlin coroutines were recently released. We use them in our projects on backend. In this talk I will show you how to use it in real back-end based applications, common patterns and problems you could face.

event.speaker: Roman Elizarov
event.title: JetBrains Night
event.subject: Корутины в Kotlin на сервере
event.description: Мы поговорим о традиционных проблемах масштабирования серверных приложений на JVM и о том, как их можно решить с помощью асинхронного кода, который теперь как никогда просто писать благодаря корутинам в Котлине. Мы увидим, как дизайн, основанный на корутинах и структурной многозадачности, позволяет избежать традиционных проблем асинхронного кода, связанных с управлением ресурсами, обработкой ошибок и отменой запросов.

event.speaker: Mikhail Krainov
event.title: JetBrains Night
event.subject: Full-stack приложение на Kotlin глазами фронтенд-разработчика
event.description: В этом докладе я расскажу о том, как написать full-stack приложение на Kotlin. Мы рассмотрим различные технологии из мира Kotlin, делающие этот язык таким мощным и удобным инструментом: создадим мультиплатформенный проект, переиспользующий код между Kotlin/JVM и Kotlin/JS, напишем фронтенд с помощью удобных DSL для React и CSS и воспользуемся корутинами для клиент-серверного взаимодействия.

event.speaker: Donald Bruce
event.title: Kotlin Kenya User Group
event.subject: Process Management & CPU Scheduling
event.description: Diving into deeper insights on Process Management and CPU Scheduling.

event.speaker: Cody Engel
event.title: Chicago Kotlin Users Group
event.subject: Kotlin + Android
event.description: Cody will take you through his journey from Kotlin newbie to evangelist at one of Chicago's fastest growing technology companies. Along the way you'll learn helpful tips both related to writing Kotlin and convincing others to start using it.

event.speaker: Clay Taylor
event.title: Indianapolis Java User Group
event.subject: Async Server Side Programming in Kotlin
event.description: Coroutines is a popular asyc kotlin library that offers an alternative to more complex libraries like RxJava. We will be diving into the basics of coroutines using a Kotlin server side tool called Ktor. Ktor is a framework for building asynchronous servers and clients using the Kotlin programming language. We will walk through a simple implementation of creating an API using Ktor. We will learn the basics of coroutines to implement familiar concepts such as serving JSON content, simple routing, and handling HTTP methods.

event.speaker: Guilherme Pohlmann Da Rosa, Fabrício Rissetto
event.title: Kotlin Meetup - São Paulo
event.subject: Funcional Domain Driven Design

event.speaker: Miles Peele
event.title: New York Kotlin Meetup
event.subject: Fluent Testing with Kotlin
event.description: Tests are an integral part of writing maintainable, clean code. If your tests are verbose, your code is probably also verbose. In this talk, we'll discover how to make your tests easy to read, easy to write, and easy to maintain using Kotlin's reified types combined with inline, infix and extension functions.

event.speaker: Josh Williams
event.title: New York Kotlin Meetup
event.subject: Kotlin + AWS Lambdas: Building an API in 10 minutes
event.description: AWS Lambdas are one of the most useful tools to use when creating a backend. Allowing developers to not have to worry about the server and configurations their backend is running on, Lambdas allow you the versatility to write code in many different languages and provide many different services including providing an api; Kotlin is one of them. We will go over how to create your api with Lambdas using Kotlin and AWS Serverless.

event.speaker: Nikolai Chechin
event.title: Kotlin user group Berlin
event.subject: Building a GraphQl service with SpringBoot and Kotlin

event.speaker: Paweł Marks
event.title: Kraków Kotlin User Group
event.subject: Coroutines - what? how? why?
event.description: Coroutines have been with us for a few years now. They have been even considered stable for over half a year. Still lots of folks are afraid of them. Judging by number of questions about them on Stack Overflow and other sites there is still a lot of misconceptions and bad intuitions involving use of coroutines. In my short talk I would like to clarify what it means for function to be suspended and explain why sometimes our asyncs are in fact synchronous. I will also presents you most basic building blocks provieded by kotlinx.coroutines.core library, that we will use later during workshop.

event.speaker: Marie Katrine Ekeberg, Jarle Hansen
event.title: javaBin Oslo
event.subject: Exploring Kotlin - A Walkthrough for Developers
event.description: Kotlin is quickly becoming one of the favorite JVM-languages among developers. In this meetup, we'll walk you through the language and its features and show you some of the possibilities that Kotlin gives you. We'll explore how Kotlin differs from Java, its core language features, how you can get started and more!

event.speaker: Rahul Dominic
event.title: Kotlin Waterloo P2P
event.subject: Intro to Functional Programming in Kotlin
event.description: Kotlin provides a seamless integration of Object Oriented and Functional styles and is a great tool for getting the best of both worlds. This talk will provide a good opportunity to learn about functional programming as well as how you can achieve neater and more concise code in Kotlin by utilizing its functional abilities.

event.speaker: Venkat Subramaniam
event.title: BlrKotlin - Kotlin User Group
event.subject: The Magic of Delegates in Kotlin
event.description: Very many good books on OO design have advised us to choose delegation over inheritance. Yet, most developers using OO languages like Java use inheritance predominantly compared to delegation. Part of the reason is the lack of support for delegation when compared to inheritance. In this presentation we will see how Kotlin has first class support for delegation. We will look at how delegation helps us better model relationships and take a look at some usecases of applying delegates in Kotlin.

event.speaker: Venkat Subramaniam
event.title: BlrKotlin - Kotlin User Group
event.subject: Creating Internal DSLs with Kotlin
event.description: Domain Specific Languages are quite common: Gradle API, Rake, Ant, CSS, to name a few. Internal DSLs ride on the language capabilities and remove the need to create specific parsers. To serve as a host, however, the language should have top notch fluency and must be highly expressive. In this presentation we will see how Kotlin fits that bill and how to trick the language to creating DSLs.

event.speaker: Taras Teslyuk
event.title: Lviv Kotlin User Group
event.subject: Android, Kotlin... What is next? (a brief guide to mobile architecture)

event.speaker: Michal Harakal
event.title: Kotlin User Group Munich - KUG Munich
event.subject: Kotlin multiplatform roller
event.description: coaster ride or how I've rewritten a conference app over the weekend

event.speaker: Shagen Ogandzhanian
event.title: Kotlin User Group Munich - KUG Munich
event.subject: Kotlin and JS interop, what's next
event.description: How to use javascript libraries in Kotlin world

event.speaker: Leonid Popescu
event.title: Kotlin User Group Munich - KUG Munich
event.subject: Hybrid SDKs or how we started with Kotlin/Multiplatform without trashing the existing code base

event.speaker: Sean Massie
event.title: Kotlin Portland User Group
event.subject: Kotlin, standing on the shoulders of Giants
event.description: A discussion on the wonders of Java and what Kotlin has done to build on them.

event.speaker: Anton Korotkikh
event.title: Kotlin Moscow User Group
event.subject: Системы обмена сообщениями в корпоративной архитектуре
event.description: — типы систем обмена сообщениями и их применение в ИТ-архитектуре; — кейсы использования: типовые задачи и их решения на примере внутри Leroy Merlin и других компаниях; — ошибки и подводные камни, с которыми сталкиваются разработчики.

event.speaker: Roman Nevolin
event.title: Kotlin Moscow User Group
event.subject: Кому нужен Kotlin на бэкенде и как с ним жить
event.description: — зачем использовать Kotlin на бэкенде и как мы работаем с ним в Revolut; — что происходит, когда Java-разработчикам дают Kotlin, и какие ошибки они при этом совершают; — как привычную разработку на бэкенде адаптировать под Kotlin, с какими проблемами при этом можно столкнуться и как решать их.

event.speaker: Pavel Yurkin
event.title: Kotlin Moscow User Group
event.subject: Распил монолита в Леруа Мерлен. Наш опыт перехода на микросервисную архитектуру.
event.description: Все крупные компании проходят через эту стадию — когда бизнес не хочет по-старому, а монолит не может по-новому. И разбираться с этим нам — простым разработчикам. Приходите послушать, как мы решали эту проблему в Леруа Мерлен, на какие грабли наступили и что у нас получилось в итоге.

event.speaker: Matt Moore
event.title: Chicago Kotlin Users Group
event.subject: Mob Programming Kotlin + Kafka
event.description:
Mob programming is a software development approach where the whole team works on the same thing, at the same time, in the same space, and at the same computer.

Come join us for an interactive meet up where we'll have fun digging into Kafka messaging in Kotlin! Kafka is used for building real-time streaming data pipelines that reliably get data between systems or applications.

Using mob programming is a great way to learn from each other and build a small Kotlin project! We hope to see you!

event.speaker: Tomás Hanley
event.title: Dublin Kotlin User Group
event.subject: Kotlin Coroutines - Case Study and Lessons Learned
event.description:
Asynchronous code can get really messy really quickly. Callback hell was named callback hell for a reason. There are some good ways to avoid this in your design, but sometimes you have to live with some ugly old async API. Maybe because it's provided by a third party, or maybe it's just too difficult to rip out and rewrite. What you can do in this case is to write a Kotlin extension/wrapper on top of the API.

Kotlin Coroutines are a fantastic way to clean up ugly async APIs. They can make your async code as easy to read and understand as sequential code, but give you all the benefits of non blocking async code. In this session I'm going to show you how I took an ugly asynchronous API and wrote a Kotlin extension on top of it using coroutines and channels to make it super clean and easy to use. I'll also be sharing some of the lessons and best practices we learned along the way.

This is a beginner-friendly event. No previous knowledge of Kotlin is required, however we recommend familiarity with at least another programming language.

event.speaker: Lovis
event.title: Kotlin User Group Hamburg
event.subject: Microservices with Ktor
event.description: Ktor is a Kotlin framework for creating web servers (and clients). Unlike other frameworks, Ktor is written entirely in Kotlin and can therefore use language features such as Coroutines, reified Generics and Extension Functions more effectively. With little overhead, fast results and good performance, Ktor is especially interesting for microservices. If you are bored with Spring, you will find what you are looking for here. All others learn at least something new.

event.speaker: Mathias Düsterhöft
event.title: Kotlin User Group Hamburg
event.subject: Fight cold startup times for Kotlin or Java functions on AWS Lambda using GraalVM and the AWS newly announced Custom Lambda Runtimes
event.description: In a live-coding session we'll see how a Custom Runtime can be implemented in Kotlin and how we can run our application as a native image that we create with the help of GraalVM

event.speaker: Guy Heylens
event.title: Kotlin Belgium User Group
event.subject: Serverside development with Kotlin and ktor
event.description:
Do you need a backend for your webapp, Android app or company? Why not try Kotlin with ktor, it's lightweight, scalable and multiplatform. You can easily build a backend using DSL's and coroutines.

Ktor runs in standard server environments, like Google's App Engine, which will host and scale your backend automatically.

I will guide you through the process of setting up a ktor project, build a small web api and set it up on Docker.

event.speaker: David Gonzalez
event.title: Kotlin Belgium User Group
event.subject: Building a library for Android and iOS using Kotlin Multiplatform
event.description: Sharing code between platforms is a powerful technique, but it may be hard to accomplish without rich APIs that we have in Android, JVM, or iOS platforms. Kotlin Multiplatform libraries can be used to fix that, bringing rich APIs directly in the common Kotlin code.

event.speaker: Pedro Félix
event.title: Kotlin Lisboa
event.subject: Programação Assíncrona em Kotlin usando Corotinas
event.description:
A programação assíncrona assume atualmente importância crescente no desenvolvimento de aplicações distribuídas, onde uma parte significativa do código tem a responsabilidade de coordenar interações com sistemas externos.

É reflexo desta importância a recente introdução do conceito de método/função assíncrona e do operador await nas linguagens C#, JavaScript e Python.

Recentemente a linguagem Kotlin também introduziu mecanismos específicos para a programação assíncrona, contudo optou por seguir um caminho ligeiramente diferente e basear esses mecanismos no conceito de corotina.

event.speaker: Francisco Costa e Luís Soares
event.title: Kotlin Lisboa
event.subject: Creating web APIs with Kotlin
event.description: Apresentaremos algumas técnicas e bibliotecas/frameworks importantes na construção de APIs REST com Kotlin. Por exemplo, demonstraremos que poderá facilmente usá-lo com Spring. Pelo caminho, vamos também abordar alguns mitos, truques e dicas.

event.speaker: Derek Berner
event.title: Nashville Java Users' Group
event.subject: Intro to Kotlin
event.description: Kotlin is JetBrain's alternative language on the JVM that has been surging in popularity. Come for an introduction into the language as we'll walk through the basics of the language and see more complex examples.

event.speaker: Victor Rentea
event.title: Bucharest Software Craftsmanship Community
event.subject: Kotlin Kindergarten ep #03
event.description:
Sick of Java? Let’s try Kotlin : probably the next de-facto standard for Android apps, and a cool compact language to write your JUnit tests in.

Victor will broadcast 1 hour of live-coding playing around with Kotlin.

event.speaker: Martial Maillot
event.title: Lyon Kotlin User Group
event.subject: La programmation orienté objet en Kotlin

event.speaker: Kumar
event.title: ThoughtWorks Bangalore
event.subject: Kotlin Hiring Bootcamp
event.description: This 2-day workshop would be a hands-on session to explore Kotlin using different programming paradigms such as functional, reactive etc. The idea is to come together, brainstorm and learn a new programming language!

event.speaker: Artur Skowroński
event.title: Rzeszów Java User Group
event.subject: TBC - multithreading with Project Loom and Kotlin's Coroutines
event.description: Both Java and Kotlin are languages that are heavily used in Distributed Systems, handling multiple asynchronous operations simultaneously. Blocking is not an option in such an environment, but let’s be honest, we crave for the easier synchronous world. That’s why JVM as a platform has an inherent focus on providing an easier option of multithreaded programming. Today, I’d like to compare two of such options - Kotlin Coroutines and Project Loom, that want to provide fibers and continuations to core Java.

event.speaker: Anton Kostanjsek
event.title: Kotlin Karlsruhe User Group
event.subject: Kotlin and the Chrono24 Android-app
event.description: - History - Concept and architecture - Rewrite: Challenges/Kotlin specific benefit

event.speaker: Emmanuel Vinas
event.title: Riviera Dev 2019
event.subject: Deep Dive Kotlin:Du Hello World AU Bytecode
event.description: -Comment aborder un nouveau langage? Les uns répondent en codant, les autres en regardant son fonctionnement en détail. Dans ce 'Deep Dive' nous vous proposons les deux ! Quoi de mieux qu'un live-coding d'un exercice complet pour découvrir les idiomes du langage. Puis en regardant sous le capot, les fonctionnalités que nous n'avons pas (encore) en Java, ne resteront plus un mystère pour vous !

event.speaker: Vitaly Bragilevsky
event.title: Apps Conf 2019
event.subject: Не морочьте мне голову со своим функциональным программированием
event.description:
-Адепты функционального программирования очень любят завлекать неопытных программистов обещаниями идеальной выразительности кода, его стопроцентной корректности, лёгкости поддержки и простоты рефакторинга. Иные даже пророчат высочайшую производительность и попадание после смерти напрямую в райские кущи. Опытные разработчики знают, что ничего такого не бывает, программирование — это тяжёлый труд, а серебряные пули, может, и помогают от вампиров, но никак не в процессе разработки ПО. С другой стороны, если что-то может хоть как-то облегчить труд программиста, то почему бы не попробовать этим чем-то воспользоваться?

-В своём докладе я сформулирую основные элементы функционального стиля программирования, приведу примеры их воплощения в коде на двух языках - Swift и Kotlin, а также попытаюсь предложить прагматичный подход к их применению. Разработчики этих языков прекрасно знакомы с функциональным программированием, поэтому они смогли сделать удобным его применение «в малом», предусмотрев все необходимые компоненты. Причём чем дальше, тем качественнее и полнее соответствующая поддержка реализуется.

event.speaker: Dinorah Tovar
event.title: WeWork
event.subject: Arquitectura en Android: Haciendo magia con el desarrollo en Kotlin
event.description:
-Aprende las diferencias entre Java y Kotlin, el nuevo lenguaje oficial de Android y por qué es magia que puedes entender en poco tiempo de manera eficiente.

Conoce los principios básicos de Clean Architecture para garantizar que tu desarrollo en Android sobreviva en una industria en constante evolución.

Comparte una pizza con nosotros mientras discutimos sobre las mejores practicas en Android.

event.speaker: Adit Lal
event.title: BlrKotlin - Kotlin User Group
event.subject: The power of inline
event.description: This talk highlights the usages of Inline in Kotlin. How it works and how it helps increase code quality. This session will provide some details on experimental features like inline classes, the difference between inline, crossInline and noinline.

event.speaker: Adit Lal
event.title: BlrKotlin - Kotlin User Group
event.subject: Coroutines & Asynchronous Programming
event.description: This talk is targeted for audiences who are already a bit familiar or atleast had a short introduction to Kotlin Coroutines. We will dig deeper to various APIs of Coroutines and how to use them more efficiently. We will also explore experimental features of Kotlin coroutines - channels and the select API. Finally we will have a look how to use Coroutines with Rx with kotlinx-coroutines-rx2

event.speaker: Wojtek Kalicinski
event.title: Madrid Android Developer Group
event.subject: All for one and one for all. Kotlin Mutiplatform
event.description: The promise of cross-platform frameworks looks great on paper, and some of them do a pretty good job delivering actual results. But with inherent differences between platforms, is "build once, run anywhere" even worth pursuing? Learn how you can share parts of your app between mobile platforms (and even the web!) without compromising quality, and delivering a best in class Android experience. During this talk I'll explain the basics of setting up Kotlin Multiplatform projects, show an example app sharing business logic in Kotlin between Android, iOS and the web, and show how to implement your own Kotlin MP libraries.

event.speaker: Pavel Finkelstein
event.title: DevsDay.ru
event.subject: Kotlin в продакшн
event.description: На встрече Павел предлагает обсудить, как живётся котлину в энтерпрайзе большей или меньшей коварности. Он расскажет, на какие грабли успел наступить примерно за два года активной разработки, какие плюшки и удобности нашёл, и что его удивило.

event.speaker: Sébastien Deleuze
event.title: Sourcelabs B.V.
event.subject: Spring Boot with Kofu and Coroutines

event.speaker: Allard Buijze
event.title: Sourcelabs B.V.
event.subject: Bootiful CQRS and Event Sourcing with Axon

event.speaker: Chris Celiberti
event.title: New York Kotlin Meetup
event.subject: Corda / Blockchain
event.description: With Blockchain being all the rage these days right, wrong or indifferent companies are looking at this technology to create de-centralized products and services. StreetWire will present its real estate application built on Kotlin using R3's Corda open source platform exploring the workings of the blockchain, Corda's framework, Kotlin code and technical aspects of the application.

event.speaker: Talon Ghost
event.title: New York Kotlin Meetup
event.subject: Nimble Web Framework
event.description: Let's build a web app with Kotlin! In this talk I would like to share how Nimble makes it easy peasy to start building web applications that share the same data structures and logic as your backend Kotlin service! We will explore a small example that consumes data from the internet and renders content onto a page while investigating the simple API exposed by Nimble!

event.speaker: Andrey Mischenko
event.title: Singapore Kotlin User group
event.subject: Kotlin Part
event.description: This talk is about the current state of the Kotlin as a `tool` for multiplatform development for Android and iOS. The presented approach can be considered as a solution for the old problem of sharing code between platforms and might be interesting for both Android and iOS developers

event.speaker: Guy Heylens
event.title: Kotlin Belgium User Group
event.subject: Kotlin/Native: The Good, The Bad, and the Ugly
event.description: The promise of write-once-run-everywhere has haunted native mobile developers since the first time someone whispered the words “phone gap”. But what if there was a way to have cross-platform development with a modern, type-safe language? JetBrains is trying to make this happen with Kotlin/Native, which compiles to LLVM bytecode, and can run on iOS, Android, and even the web. Learn more about some of the benefits of working with Kotlin/Native, some of the drawbacks, and a few of the (current) potential dealbreakers when it comes to using this exciting new technology in a real app.

event.speaker: Paul Reilly
event.title: Kotlin Office Hours
event.subject: Kotlin MPP in action on the Argus Project
event.description: Tonight, I will present a status update on the Argus project. We will focus on a Kotlin MPP support library used to provide data from The Movie DB (TMDB) visiting some Kotlin features used in the library (tmdb-lib at https://github.com/pajato/tmdb-lib), specifically parsing Json with Kotlin Serialization, accessing TMDB data sets using coroutines and testing using Ktor. The talk will be highly interactive as I seek out feedback and suggestions from the Kotlin gurus in attendance.

event.speaker: Michel Onwordi
event.title: Kotlin user group Berlin
event.subject: Type Assisted Development: A case for Inline Classes

event.speaker: Oleksii Fedorov
event.title: Kotlin user group Berlin
event.subject: How to Avoid False Sense of Null-safety?

event.speaker: Marie Katrine Ekeberg, Anders Mikkelsen
event.title: Oslo Kotlin Meetup
event.subject: Kotlin hack and learn - coroutines
event.description: Want to hack and learn coroutines with us? Coroutines is a popular topic these days when parallell and asynchronous programming is discussed. In this meetup we will take a look at coroutines, their differences to threads and how you can use it in your project. Instead of just a presentation, we will hack and learn together! Bring your laptop, we will provide pizza and tasks. To get you started we will even throw a short introductory presentation into the mix.

event.speaker: Gareth Fleming
event.title: Kotlin Belfast User Group
event.subject: The transition from Java to the wonderful world of Koltin

event.speaker: Dmitry Kandalov
event.title: Kotlin Belfast User Group
event.subject: Writing a fully-working game of Snake in less than an hour of pure Kotlin + IntelliJ

event.speaker: Dave Glover
event.title: Sydney Kotlin User Group
event.subject: Building an End-to-End Secure, Scalable IoT Serverless Solution
event.description: Learn how to build and run your IoT solutions securely and at scale. We will cover device security with Azure Sphere, distribute intelligence to the edge with Azure IoT Edge, and building real-time serverless solutions with Azure Functions and Azure SignalR

event.speaker: Dmytro Gorodnitskiy
event.title: Lviv Kotlin User Group
event.subject: Android navigation components: як не заблукати серед трьох сосен

event.speaker: Anna Shkabara
event.title: Kotlin Dnipro
event.subject: A short story about Android BLE

event.speaker: Marcin Moskała
event.title: Kotlin Night Warsaw
event.subject: Understanding Kotlin Coroutines
event.description:
Kotlin Coroutines is a powerful tool. Well implemented concept of suspendable computation... It is a dream of many theoretics of concurrent programming for a long time. But how it is possible? How do Kotlin coroutines really work? Why are they important? What do they introduce? And finally, how you can use them in your project?

In this talk, I will show you how to use Kotlin Coroutines and what makes them so special and so efficient. I will also discuss if they are an alternative to RxJava.

event.speaker: Arturo Mejia
event.title: Kotlin Toronto
event.subject: A gentle introduction to Kotlin Coroutines
event.description: In this talk, we're are going to introduce the concept of Kotlin Coroutines in an easy and simple way. We are going to talk about its core concepts, what's makes them special, how you can use and test them, and finally how they are different from other alternatives like Rx.

event.speaker: Yahor Berdnikov
event.title: Kotlin User Group Munich
event.subject: First stable release of CoRedux. What is change since previous talk and how it look now?

event.speaker: Ilya Chernikov
event.title: Kotlin User Group Munich
event.subject: Kotlin Scripting. Using Kotlin as a scripting language

event.speaker: Alfred Foltin
event.title: Kotlin.amsterdam
event.subject: Hacking with Kotlin
event.description: Have a Kotlin project you want to show? Just getting started with Kotlin and need some help? Interested in some Kotlin hacks? This evening is for you.

event.speaker: Akinrolie Shola Slick
event.title: Kotlin Ondo User Group
event.subject: Kotlin Webinar Ondo
event.description: Experience the power of the fastest growing language in the world. Learn mobile development with ease and get resources, tools, and latest updates on Kotlin and more.

event.speaker: Ryan Perkins
event.title: Chicago Kotlin Users Group
event.subject: Kotlin Multiplatform
event.description: This talk will discuss what multi-platform and native Kotlin is, how organizations and teams can utilize it in their projects, and the advantages and disadvantages of adopting it.

event.speaker: Falk Appel
event.title: Kotlin Karlsruhe User Group
event.subject: Build your own Kotlin Dependency Injection

event.speaker: Andrey Govorovsky
event.title: Apps Conf 2019
event.subject: Model Driven-конфигурация приложения на Kotlin DSL
event.description:
Трудно представить современное мобильное приложение без удаленной конфигурации - A/B-тесты, запуск новых фич, замена строк, графических ресурсов.

В ходе доклада мы рассмотрим как создать DSL на Kotlin для описания конфигурации приложения и как из него сгенерировать парсеры с валидацией, документацию и настройки разработчика.

event.speaker: Rainer Kern
event.title: GDG Bratislava
event.subject: Coroutines in Kotlin 1.3 & Assisted ViewModel Injection
event.description: Prezentácie si pre vás pripravili softvérový architekt a Kotlinový nadšenec Rainer Kern a šéf Android developerov v Sygicu Miroslav Kacera.

event.speaker: Cyril Findeling
event.title: Kotlin Paris Meetup
event.subject: Découvrir Kotlin avec des mini-jeux Android

event.speaker: Robin Penea
event.title: Kotlin Paris Meetup
event.subject: De Java à Kotlin: L'histoire d'une migration Android

event.speaker: Jag Saund
event.title: The San Francisco Android GDG
event.subject: Kotlin Coroutines and Channels: From 0 to 100
event.description: We all know multithreaded application development can make you 🤔😡. Chasing down deadlocks and race conditions can keep you up at night. But Kotlin introduces another way to tackle the problem. This talk introduces the fundamentals of both Coroutines and Channels with a simple Coffee Shop analogy. It'll take you from the foundation to a few different approaches on solving common problems. See how you can add Coroutines and Channels to your toolbox of asynchronous programming.

event.speaker: Sean Massie
event.title: Kotlin Portland User Group
event.subject: Kotlin, standing on the shoulders of Giants.
event.description: This talk will be a discussion on the wonders of Java and what Kotlin has done to build on them.

event.speaker: Lauren Yew
event.title: Google Developer Group Austin
event.subject: Threading Made Easy! A Busy Developer’s Guide to Kotlin Coroutines
event.description: - What coroutines are and how they function - How to use them (with real world examples and demos) - Where and why you should use coroutines in your app - How to avoid pitfalls of coroutines - How they compare to other threading solutions like callbacks and RxJava

event.speaker: Daniele Campogiani, Giovanni Catania
event.title: GDG DevFest Pisa 2019
event.subject: Functional Validation with Arrow and Bow
event.description: An introduction to some data types of Arrow and Bow: we will use them to validate a form in an application. Code samples will be in Kotlin and Swift

event.speaker: Jonas Schmid
event.title: Mobile Romandie Beer
event.subject: Kotlin for Swift developers
event.description: Swift and Kotlin have a lot of concepts in common but they also have a few notable differences. Knowing both languages can help you write better code and share ideas between developers of “the other platform”. > We will cover the basics of Kotlin before converting a Swift app into a Kotlin one. We will use concepts such as sealed classes, extensions and of course coroutines to make our code more robust and readable.

event.speaker: Nazarii Ivanchuk
event.title: Kotlin London
event.subject: Suspending functions, coroutines and state machines
event.description: Suspending functions, coroutines and state machines Explore. How Kotlin coroutine works under the hood. Introduction into the dark arts of the coroutines transformation during compilation.

event.speaker: Pablisco
event.title: Kotlin London
event.subject: A null hypothesis
event.description: We are going to explore how we use nullable types in Kotlin — going through the benefits, caveats and alternatives that can make or break our code. What can we do to make our code more readable, maintainable and less error bound? What should we avoid? It may contain traces of opinions.

event.speaker: Martial Maillot
event.title: Lyon Kotlin User Group
event.subject: La programmation orienté objet en Kotlin
event.description: 20 minutes en livecoding pour découvrir les listes.

event.speaker: Hadi Hariri
event.title: St. Petersburg Kotlin User Group
event.subject: Introduction to Ktor for server-side development
event.description: Ktor is an asynchronous web framework built from the the ground up using Kotlin and coroutines. It provides developers the ability to create both server and client applications targeting a variety of platforms including JVM, JavaScript and macOS, Windows and Linux via Kotlin/Native. In this talk we’re going to focus primarily on Ktor as a server application, see how simple it is to create asynchronous and robust server side applications, deployment models, features it provides out of the box, its extensibility model, and how it’s different to some of the other existing solutions on the market

event.speaker: Ionut Balosin
event.title: Voxxed Days Bucharest 2019
event.subject: Desugaring Kotlin features and their performance impact
event.description: In this presentation I will try to demystify a few Kotlin language features and to present how they are compiled into the bytecode in order to have a better understanding about what happens under the hood.

event.speaker: George Adams, Stephen Byrne
event.title: Kotlin Night Rochester
event.subject: Kotlin - A brief introduction to the language.
event.description: We will cover enough of the structure andsyntax that hopefully everybody will be able to follow along for the rest of the evening.

event.speaker: George Adams, Stephen Byrne
event.title: Kotlin Night Rochester
event.subject: Web Services - Comparison of the leading Kotlin-based web frameworks - Ktor andJavalin

event.speaker: George Adams, Stephen Byrne
event.title: Kotlin Night Rochester
event.subject: Desktop GUIs
event.description: TornadoFX, a JavaFX framework for Kotlin that uses type-safe buildersto make building views easy and readable.

event.speaker: George Adams, Stephen Byrne
event.title: Kotlin Night Rochester
event.subject: Coroutines - Asynchronous programming without expensive threads and context switches.

event.speaker: Venkat Subramaniam, Josh Long
event.title: DevNexus 2019
event.subject: Kotlin jumpstart with Venkat and Josh, part 1
event.description: A two hour, live-coded, presentation on getting you on the road to Kotlin with Josh Long and Venkat S!

event.speaker: Dev Gupta
event.title: DevNexus 2019
event.subject: Spring Boot and Kotlin
event.description: Let’s showcase how Kotlin makes Java developers lives easier in Spring Boot

event.speaker: Venkat Subramaniam
event.title: DevNexus 2019
event.subject: Developing Micronaut Applications with Kotlin
event.description: If you’re developing with Kotlin or getting started with the language, come to this talk to find out how to program your Micronaut application with Kotlin. Kotlin brings a variety of interesting features for fluency, type safety, and asynchronous programming. Learn how to leverage those capacities of the language in the context of Micronaut.

event.speaker: Pavel Vlodarskiy
event.title: SegFault University
event.subject: Kotlin plus Spring minus Adnotacje
event.description: Spring 5 dostał natywne wsparcie dla Kotlina z wygodnym DSLem i wygląda na to, że już po ludzku można ogarnąć konfigurację w trakcie kompilacji bez żadnych adnotacji, dziwnych CGlib proxy i majstrowania w runtime.

event.speaker: Marcin Moskala
event.title: SegFault University
event.subject: Kotlin for Java developers
event.description: What’s all the fuss about Kotlin? On this workshop, you will discover it yourself. It will cover the most important Kotlin features. Show null-safety, extension functions and why collection processing in Kotlin is so good.

event.speaker: Dmitry Kandalov
event.title: Voxxed Days Bucharest 2019
event.subject: Live Coding Kotlin/Native Snake
event.description: Dmitry Kandalov has been programming and trying to get better at it since DOS times. The last 10 years or so he spent in Java and JVM languages land, most recently focusing on Kotlin.

event.speaker: Victor Rentea
event.title: Kotlin Kindergarten
event.subject: Kotlin Kindergarten ep #02
event.description: Sick of Java? Let’s try Kotlin : probably the next de-facto standard for Android apps, and a cool compact language to write your JUnit tests in.

event.speaker: Mathias Düsterhöft
event.title: Serverless Hamburg
event.subject: Fighting cold startup issues for your Kotlin Lambda with GraalVM
event.description: how we can fight cold startup times for Kotlin or Java functions on AWS Lambda using GraalVM and the AWS newly announced Custom Lambda Runtimes.

event.speaker: Mathias Düsterhöft
event.title: Chicago Kotlin User Group
event.subject: Building and Using Kotlin DSL's
event.description:
Join us as we hear from two of our regular attendees, John Burns and Jonathan Bisson as they speak about building and utilizing Domain Specific Languages (DSLs for short) in Kotlin. Domain specific languages are subsets of functions in a programming language designed specifically to ease development and communicate intention more effectively within a particular problem-space.

John Burns will kick things off around 6pm by examining how Kotlin's language features enable us to construct a DSL for building static websites.

Jonathan Bisson will follow up speaking about how he utilizes Kotlin in his daily professional life and he will explore some of the applications he has built, some of the libraries used (SpringBoot, TornadoFX) and the science surrounding them.

event.speaker: Ersin Ertan
event.title: Kotlin Waterloo P2P
event.subject: Kotlin coroutines
event.description: Coroutines have large benefits over the regular threading model of Java. Most threads wait on IO 99% of the time and coroutines make use of this time to perform real work. Scalability is dramatically increased and memory consumption is reduced.

event.speaker: Ionut Balosin
event.title: Voxxed Days Bucharest 2019
event.subject: Desugaring Kotlin features and their performance impact
event.description: In this presentation I will try to demystify few Kotlin language features and to present how they are compiled into the bytecode in order to have a better understanding about what happens under the hood.

event.speaker: Mercedes Wyss
event.title: GreachConf
event.subject: Kotlin & Implications in an IoT project
event.description:
Develop IoT solutions with Kotlin is possible thanks to the incorporation to Kotlin as a first class programming language to Android and the becoming of Android Things, an optimized version of Android for embedded devices. This talk is looking for explore the aspects around IoT projects, Hardware, Security, Server Side, Data Analysis from the hand of Android Things and Kotlin.

The Internet of Things is a technology that has been echoing for some time. Arriving to generate interesting and attractive solutions. It usually happens that those who develop this type of solutions know about the Hardware, or they only have knowledge of the Software side. This talk seeks to explore all those aspects around IoT in the hand of a real project for monitoring fishbowls (something that you can implement at home).

In the hardware side, we will use sensors and different technologies for handle the information obtained from these (Raspberry PI, Arduino, etc). Since we want to show how to use Kotlin for develop IoT solutions, we will use Android Things with Kotlin and Raspberry PI.

The server side, using Serverless or IoT cloud solutions, options to analyze our information. Finally, is important take some considerations over the security aspects in IoT projects, although there are not yet 100% solid solutions, there are already efforts to solve this.

event.speaker: Josh Owens
event.title: Kotlin Portland User Group
event.subject: Our first kotlin android app
event.description: A look at how two Kroger apprentices built an internal app to facilitate regression testing on Android devices using deep links, Kotlin, MVVM patterns, and a node middleware server built with Koa. They will cover tools they found, UI patterns, and the learning experience behind building your first Android app.

event.speaker: Vicente Martínez
event.title: Guadalajara Hack Nights
event.subject: Room for Android in Kotlin
event.description: Room is a persistence library that provides a level of abstraction over SQLite. It has many advantages over traditional ORM's and we will be learning a proper use of it by creating a simple app that remind us when and how much to pay for our credit cards. We will be talking about some of the common designs to create relationships using DAOS in Room and accessing Live Data. Also, we will be discovering some hot topics using Kotlin for Android

event.speaker: Chris Koeberle
event.title: Kotlin DFW
event.subject: Kotlin Code Generation with KotlinPoet
event.description:
This talk will cover Kotlin code generation with KotlinPoet. KotlinPoet is a Kotlin (and Java) API for generating kotlin source files.

Sometimes a task is repetitive enough that it seems like you shouldn’t actually have to do it, but not so repetitive that you can just tell the IDE to handle it. KotlinPoet will help you generate Kotlin code, whether in an annotation processor, in a local script, or even to share a common definition between server and client. We’ll look at how it works, and some tips and tricks for solving common problems with it!

event.speaker: Valeriy Ovechkin
event.title: San Francisco Kotlin Meetup
event.subject: How Caviar migrated their Android app from Java to 100% Kotlin

event.speaker: KJ Jeon
event.title: Kotlin Night Seoul
event.subject: Effective Java and Kotlin
event.description: The book, 'Effective Java' introduces guidelines for implementing efficient and well-designed Java programs. Kotlin has a design that can be applied to these guidelines. The Kotlin Reference document cites this book to support the explanation. In this session, we will go over the rules of the 'Effective Java' and share how it is reflected in Kotlin or how it can be applied.

event.speaker: SH Lee
event.title: Kotlin Night Seoul
event.subject: Create elegant code using Kotlin
event.description: Introduction to how to make code elegant by using high order function, extension function, function literals with receivers, DSL etc. showing example of Kotlin code actually applied to FLO.

event.speaker: HS Kang
event.title: Kotlin Night Seoul
event.subject: Why Kotin? - from Java developer's point of view
event.description: We will share you why Java developers feel inconvenienced while using Java by comparing the Java example code with the Kotlin example code, introducing the merits and why the Java developers should change the project to Kotlin.

event.speaker: JW Heo
event.title: Kotlin Night Seoul
event.subject: Kotlin + AWS Lambda and API Gateway
event.description: Create and deploy a simple API using Kotlin and the AWS SAM (serverless application model). The script to build and distribute is also written in Kotlin (Gradle + Kotlin DSL).

event.speaker: Dmitry Kandalov
event.title: Kotlin London
event.subject: Live coding algorithms
event.description:
This is live coding session in Kotlin with TDD which will cover binary search, merge sort and heap/quick sort. Although these algorithms might seem simple, there are a few subtleties related to the algorithms and their implementation on JVM.

The session assumes that you're already familiar with the algorithms to some extent.

event.speaker: Guillermo Orellana
event.title: Kotlin London
event.subject: Kotlin Multiplatform
event.description:
Nowadays Kotlin is more than a JVM language - it allows you to target so many more different platforms.

In this talk we'll explore how Kotlin powers the creation of a web app that served as an introduction to full stack engineering for somebody with an Android background.

We will explore pros, cons and pitfalls and have fun deploying to the could!

event.speaker: Ignacio Arces
event.title: Guadalajara Kotlin User Group
event.subject: Painless Dependency InjeKtion
event.description: Hablaremos de la importancia de DI para crear código modular y altamente testeable. Diferentes tipos de DI con PROs/CONs y daremos un vistazo a las diferentes opciones disponibles para implementar DI con Kotlin; desde las librerías tradicionales de Java como Spring y Guice hasta las opciones 100% Kotlin como KoDeIn e Insert-Koin

event.speaker: David Cordova
event.title: Guadalajara Kotlin User Group
event.subject: The Strategy and Komposition
event.description: Muchas buenas practicas vienen incluidas en Kotlin por la misma forma en que esta diseñado el lenguaje y una de ellas es el favorecer la composicion de clases. Hablaremos de porque es ventajoso tener esto sobre la herencia y como podemos implementar el patron de Strategy en nuestros proyectos.

event.speaker: Zachary Smith
event.title: New York Kotlin Meetup
event.subject: Intro to Web Dev with Kotlin
event.description: With front-end web apps becoming larger and more complex, and Node.js allowing Javascript to be used on the server side, the language has had a rapid rise in popularity. But for many JVM/Android developers, the thought of getting into front end web development and the Javascript ecosystem can seem quite unpleasant. However with Kotlin's ability to target JS, we can leverage the language features we've come to love, to make the experience a bit more fun. In this talk, we'll explore how we can build a Kotlin front-end application and even use Kotlin to interact with Node.js on the server.

event.speaker: Brian Plummer
event.title: New York Kotlin Meetup
event.subject: Moshi: Kotlin Codegen
event.description: Learn how to leverage Moshi’s Kotlin codegen so your data model can be immutable and quickly parsed reflection free. I’ll discuss why this is important to us as developers, integration details, and how Moshi implemented this feature!

event.speaker: Constantine Bialik
event.title: Kotlin Office Hours
event.subject: Kotlin-DSL for Gradle: How to convert Gradle scripts to Kotlin
event.description:
Now it's more then a year since Gradle officially supports Kotlin-DSL to define projects. This (and JetBrain’s effort to support of Kotlin-Native) allows to develop most of the projects COMPLETELY in Kotlin including server side, client side, native/mobile application and build/test scripts.

However most project generating tools still create Gradle scripts in Groovy only. Even IntelliJ IDEA creates Kotlin projects with Groovy script for Gradle.

Now is the perfect time for this presentation to demonstrate how easy it is to convert Groovy script for Gradle to Kotlin-DSL script for Gradle.

event.speaker: Lorenz Schmoliner
event.title: Developer Meetup Kärnten
event.subject: Quick Intro zu Kotlin Native
event.description: Kotlin Native ermöglicht es euch Kotlin Code zu schreiben und diesen dann zu nativem plattform-spezifischen Code zu kompilieren. Unterstützte Zielplattformen sind unter anderem iOS und Android. Lorenz wird euch in einem Intro zeigen, was man sich darunter vorstellen kann.

event.speaker: Krzysztof Korbacz, Paweł Pyzik
event.title: Kielce Java User Group
event.subject: Kotlin na backendzie
event.description:
Zastanawialiście się ostatnio czy ten nowy projekt backendowy jest dobrym miejscem by spróbować Kotlina (i nie chodzi nam o ketchup)?

Ale wszystko co wiecie na temat Kotlina to wiedza pozyskana z kilku prezentacji lub blog postów, które mówią jak młodzieżowy jest to język?

Może dobrym pomysłem byłoby zapytać kogoś kto tego spróbował na własnej skórze? I oto jesteśmy my by opowiedzieć Wam naszą historię transformacji z Java Backend do Java/Kotlin Backend developerów.

Opowiemy Wam jakie Kotlin kryje w sobie pułapki, które ficzery Kotlina podobają nam się najbardziej. Przeprowadzimy Was przez recepty, które zebraliśmy w trakcie prac nad naszym ostatnim projektem.

A jako wisienka na torcie: powiemy Wam czy wybralibyśmy Kotlina ponownie dysponując wiedzą, którą dysponujemy dzisiaj.

event.speaker: Pedro Alves
event.title: Kotlin Lisboa
event.subject: Porque escolhi Kotlin para ensinar programação

event.speaker: Fábio Rito
event.title: Kotlin Lisboa
event.subject: Lightweightform - Utilização prática da linguagem em contexto multiplataforma para validar dados no Frontend e Backend

event.speaker: Alonso Torres
event.title: Madrid GUG
event.subject: Kotlin para Grooviers
event.description:
Google lo soporta como lenguaje de primer nivel para Android, muchas bibliotecas le dan soporte al primer nivel e incluso nuestro querido Gradle lo va a usar para implementar su DSL alternativa./p>

No es ningún secreto que Jetbrains, los creadores del lenguaje, se inspiraron muchísimo en Groovy. Eso nos coloca a los programadores de Groovy en un punto ideal porque con poco esfuerzo podemos aprender este nuevo lenguaje trayéndonos mucha experiencia./p>

En esta charla voy a hacer un recorrido por algunas de las principales características del lenguaje y ponerlas frente a frente con Groovy. Veremos ventajas e inconvenientes de las dos aproximaciones y espero que salgáis con bastante ideas de cómo es el lenguaje.

event.speaker: Mercedes Wyss
event.title: JBCNConf
event.subject: Kotlin & Implications in an IoT project
event.description: Develop IoT solutions with Kotlin is possible thanks to the incorporation to Kotlin as a first class programming language to Android and the becoming of Android Things, an optimized version of Android for embedded devices. This talk is looking for explore the aspects around IoT projects, Hardware, Security, Server Side, Data Analysis from the hand of Android Things and Kotlin. The Internet of Things is a technology that has been echoing for some time. Arriving to generate interesting and attractive solutions. It usually happens that those who develop this type of solutions know about the Hardware, or they only have knowledge of the Software side. This talk seeks to explore all those aspects around IoT in the hand of a real project for monitoring fishbowls (something that you can implement at home). In the hardware side, we will use sensors and different technologies for handle the information obtained from these (Raspberry PI, Arduino, etc). Since we want to show how to use Kotlin for develop IoT solutions, we will use Android Things with Kotlin and Raspberry PI. The server side, using Serverless or IoT cloud solutions, options to analyze our information. Finally, is important take some considerations over the security aspects in IoT projects, although there are not yet 100% solid solutions, there are already efforts to solve this.

event.speaker: Paulien van Alst, Brian Vermeer
event.title: JBCNConf
event.subject: My Kotlin is better than your Java!
event.description: TLDR: The big discussion: Kotlin or Java, to migrate or not to migrate and why... The world of languages on the JVM has seen alternatives to Java come and go. Kotlin is probably the most popular one at this moment. Although Java is still one of the most commonly used programming languages, Kotlin seems to keep growing very fast. Where Java is known for its verbosity, Kotlin aims at making programming easier. On the other hand, Kotlin is a mix of paradigms and forces you to learn yet another language. Moreover, with all the new features that are rapidly introduced in Java, is Kotlin actually needed? So what are the aspects where they differ from each other? In which situations should we choose the one or the other? Should we migrate to Kotlin or is Java good enough? As Kotlin claims full interoperability with Java, should we even choose? In this talk we will fire up the battle between Kotlin and Java. In this battle one of us will root for Java while the other cheers for Kotlin. Who wins? That is totally up to you. The audience will be judge and jury. So...bring it on.

event.speaker: Nicolás Patarino
event.title: GreachConf
event.subject: When Clean Architecture met Kotlin: A love story
event.description: Kotlin, a modern language bursts into the community when developers have been perfecting what they call Clean Architecture for years, some potions and spells with which to increase the power of testability and become independent of evil external agents and cruel frameworks.

event.speaker: Alberto de Avila
event.title: GreachConf
event.subject: GRAALVM with Groovy & Kotlin
event.description: Have you heard about GRAALVM? Maybe yes, but, how can we use it? In this talk we are going to see how to create images to execute our JVM applications faster and what are the GRAALVM limitations when using Groovy or Kotlin as program languagues

event.speaker: Adit Lal
event.title: BlrKotlin
event.subject: Empower Session: The Power Of Kotlin
event.description: Societe Generale which is regarded among the most forward thinking banks is organizing a meetup to structure a network of enthusiastic professionals around development trends in financial infrastructure surrounding Kotlin.This talk introduces and highlights how we could use Kotlin DSL’s and add some readability of code by enforcing the use of declarative code with minimum boilerplate, as well as look at why Kotlin is particularly good for DSLs with examples. And we are doing this with BlrKotlin (Bengaluru’s favourite Kotlin User Group).

event.speaker: Benoit Hebrard
event.title: Kotlin Copenhagen User Group
event.subject: Sealed classes
event.description: Sealed classes are often described as enums on steroids. This talk will be an introduction to how sealed classes work, and some practical applications for them.

event.speaker: Adrian Catalan
event.title: GDG Androidtitlan
event.subject: If your code looks like it's Kotlin & quacks like it's Kotlin, then it probably is swift.

event.speaker: Kevin Janvier
event.title: Kotlin Uganda User Group
event.subject: Intro to Web Dev with Kotlin
event.description: With front-end web apps becoming larger and more complex, and Node.js allowing Javascript to be used on the server side, the language has had a rapid rise in popularity. But for many JVM/Android developers, the thought of getting into front end web development and the Javascript ecosystem can seem quite unpleasant. However with Kotlin's ability to target JS, we can leverage the language features we've come to love, to make the experience a bit more fun. In this talk, we'll explore how we can build a Kotlin front-end application and even use Kotlin to interact with Node.js on the server. Learn how to leverage Kevin’s Kotlin codegen so your data model can be immutable and quickly parsed reflection free. I’ll discuss why this is important to us as developers, integration details, and how Moshi implemented this feature!

event.speaker: Alexey Shafranov
event.title: Taganrog Kotlin User Group
event.subject: Исключения в Kotlin и их особенности

event.speaker: Andrey Tereshchenko
event.title: Taganrog Kotlin User Group
event.subject: Корутины. Гибкое асинхронное программирование в Kotlin

event.speaker: Andrey Antipov
event.title: Samara Kotlin User Groups
event.subject: Тестируем выразительность языка (ломаем компилятор) на примере Kotlin
event.description: На что стоит обратить внимание при исследовании выразительных средств нового языка программирования. С какими багами и непонятностями я столкнулся в процессе исследования Kotlin

event.speaker: S M Mohi-Us Sunnat
event.title: Bangladesh Kotlin User Group
event.subject: A Day with Kotlin for DIU Students
event.description:
This is the first meetup arranged by Bangladesh Kotlin User Group for the developers of Bangladesh. In this meetup, there will be the expertise Kotlin developers of Bangladesh who will be sharing their view on Kotlin.

What will you get to know: 1) What are the scopes of using Kotlin 2) How it can ease the coding experience 3) What are the ways it benefits a developer to code? 4) Why Kotlin is the new future of Android development. 5) How to use this language in an app (Demonstration) 6) Object-oriented programming with Kotlin 7) Android with Kotlin

event.speaker: S M Mohi-Us Sunnat
event.title: Bangladesh Kotlin User Group
event.subject: Basic Uses of Kotlin in Android and Spring
event.description: Start with the Past, Present & Future of Kotlin. What will be the Future scopes of Kotlin Developers? Demonstrate the Basic Uses of Kotlin Android and Server with some simple code. Lastly, invite to join the Facebook group.

event.speaker: Alex Dunn
event.title: NDC London
event.subject: Kotlin for C# Developers
event.description: Dive into the latest craze in languages and platforms - Kotlin. This time we will be looking at it from the perspective of a .NET C# developer, draw comparisons between the languages, and bridge the gap between these 2 amazing languages. We'll look at: Kotlin as a language Platforms Kotlin is great for Object Oriented Implementations in Kotlin Extended Features Features Kotlin has that C# doesn't A demo Android application in Kotlin vs a Xamarin.Android app in C# In the end you will leave with a foundational knowledge of Kotlin and its capabilities to build awesome apps with less code. You should feel comfortable comparing C# applications to Kotlin applications and know where to find resources to learn even more!

event.speaker: Shady Selim
event.title: Career Launcher 6.0
event.subject: What's New with Kotlin for Android
event.description: What's New with Kotlin for Android

event.speaker: Andy Balaam
event.title: ACCU 2019
event.subject: Kotlin makes your Java code better
event.description: Concrete examples, based on real-world code, of how converting Java code to Kotlin improves it. We will cover: * Reducing the amount of code for common patterns like value objects and default parameters * Preventing errors using immutability, null safety and explicit inheritance * Expressing ideas more directly using pattern matching, sealed classes and conditional expressions * Less verbose functional-style code like streams and lambdas * Clearer object structure with primary and secondary constructors One of the joys of Kotlin is how easy it is to make a gradual transition from Java. All of the examples will demonstrate code that can be dropped in to an existing Java code base with little or no disruption. If we have time, we'll discuss things we wish were in Kotlin, and whether any of them are plausible on the JVM platform.

event.speaker: Ebuka Onyebinamma
event.title: Kotlin Benin User group
event.subject: Kotlin community: A necessity for every modern society
event.description: In recent times in the Tech world, precisely the software Engineering space, new technologies have evolved with kotlin as one of them, which has a very concise syntax, but powerful abilities and very versatile. Therefore, there is a need for every society to have a Kotlin community where members will be guided on learning the language and use it to solve problems around them.

event.speaker: Geoffrey Métais
event.title: Paris Android User Group
event.subject: Modern concurrency on Android with Kotlin
event.description:
Le framework Android actuel, basé sur Java incite beaucoup à créer des "callback hells" et de nombreux points de blocage via des mutex, car nous n'avons pas de moyen plus simple de garantir la "thread safety".

Avec les coroutines, Kotlin apporte un framework complet et efficace pour s'occuper de la concurrence d'une manière plus performante et surtout plus simple.

Ce talk a pour but de montrer comment tirer parti des coroutines pour se débarraser des callbacks et des synchonize.

event.speaker: Aubry Alexandre et Duponchel Nicolas
event.title: Paris Android User Group
event.subject: Rx vs Coroutines
event.description:
La librairie Rx est une solution efficace et assez répandue pour traiter l’asynchronisme. Depuis l’arrivée de Kotlin une nouvelle solution est disponible : les coroutines.

Dans cette présentation nous exposerons les basiques de Rx et des Coroutines. Nous mettrons ensuite en confrontation les 2 solutions via des cas d’usages simples, afin de tirer les avantages de chaque techno. Finalement nous essaierons ensemble de comprendre les philosophies de chaque solution.

event.speaker: Geoffrey Marizy
event.title: Paris Android User Group
event.subject: Wrapping Android callbacks
event.description:
Les coroutines et RxJava c'est bien joli mais le framework Android lui repose sur les callbacks.

Durant cette présentation, on va étendre la plateforme Android pour utiliser d'autres mécanismes ; coroutines, RxJava et LiveData. Je vous présenterai quelques techniques pour encapsuler les callbacks, et les avantages que l'on peut en tirer.

event.speaker: Anna Opoka
event.title: GDG Wrocław
event.subject: Kotlin Coroutines
event.description: Na warsztatach poznamy podstawowe elementy korutyn oraz sposoby na wykorzystanie ich w Androidowym projekcie. Przerobimy także przykładową aplikację z callbacków na Kotlin Coroutines.

event.speaker: Saúl Buentello
event.title: Kotlin CDMX User Group
event.subject: Coroutines vs Threads, are they any different?
event.description: When you read the documentation, it is said that coroutines can be suspended without blocking a thread but what is the difference between blocking and suspending? What happens when you launch a coroutine or start a thread?

event.speaker: Rafael Toledo, Consultor Líder
event.title: Kotlin Meetup - São Paulo
event.subject: Kotlin no backend com ktor
event.description: E pra esse encontro vamos ter um workshop bem legal sobre como utilizar Kotlin no Backend com ktor, com o Rafael Toledo, Consultor Lider na ThoughtWorks. Vamos aprender na prática comoLevem seus notebooks, vai ser daora! :)

event.speaker: Davide Cerbo
event.title: DevDay Salerno
event.subject: Kotlin: forse è la volta buona
event.description: Dopo 20 anni Java inizia a sentire il peso degli anni e la sua sintassi non evolve come vorremmo, ma la JVM resta sempre un ambiente affidabile ed è già in produzione presso moltissime aziende. Negli ultimi anni sono usciti molti linguaggi basati sulla JVM, ma non tutti hanno avuto il successo sperato. Kotlin ha conquistato Android e, ora, grazie a una sintassi intuitiva e grandi aziende che lo supportano potrebbe essere molto utilizzato anche nelle applicazioni web.

event.speaker: Michael Schneider
event.title: Hamburg Data Science Meetup
event.subject: Data hacking, from fast prototyping to production systems in order personalize Jimdo websites
event.description: A tool stack overview on building non blocking and near real time data products in Kotlin in order to personalize websites at Jimdo. From data sourcing using apache drill to rapid prototyping, addressing the importance of machine learning evaluation, production problems and finally a/b testing with live users. Embracing the data driven culture of learning and failing fast.

event.speaker: Evgeny Zakharov
event.title: Kotlin Moscow
event.subject: Kotlin, посмотрим насколько глубока кроличья нора
event.description: Порой возникают вопросы, почему в Kotlin некоторые вещи сделаны так, а не иначе. И на что стоит обратить внимание, если производительность играет не последнюю роль? Где же найти все ответы? Байткод! Заглянем внутрь, посмотрим на его декомпилированный вариант в Java, и большая часть вопросов исчезнет!

event.speaker: Vladislav Verminsky
event.title: Kotlin Moscow
event.subject: Поваренная книга Kotlin Native/MPP
event.description: Цель доклада — рассказать о том, что такое Kotlin Native и Multiplatform, как они связаны между собой и чем отличаются, для каких целей используются. Познакомиться с компилятором kotlin-native и его инструментами, как создавать проекты через gradle, их структура и возможности плагинов. Создадим, скомпилируем и запустим проекты для Kotlin Native — C и Kotlin MPP — JS.

event.speaker: Vladislav Verminsky
event.title: GDG Android Athens
event.subject: An introduction to Kotlin Coroutines for Android
event.description: Coroutines that fascinated devs from its early beta have graduated the experimental phase and are now stable 🎓. Coroutines provide a way to write asynchronous code sequentially making multithreaded programming more debuggable and maintainable. In this presentation Antonis will try to guide you through the main features of Coroutines that make it so special.

event.speaker: Marharyta Nedzelska
event.title: JavaDay Lviv 2019
event.subject: Rediscovering gRPC with Kotlin coroutines
event.description: Microservice architecture is now a huge trend...

event.speaker: Sergey Zolotov
event.title: JavaDay Lviv 2019
event.subject: Kotlin Coroutines in Practice
event.description: Kotlin coroutines are a hot topic and were released this year. We use them in our projects on backend. In this talk I will show you how to use it in real back-end based applications, common patterns and problems you could face

event.speaker: Mariana Bocoi
event.title: Go See Tech Talks #9
event.subject: Intro to Kotlin
event.description: Kotlin starts to take more space in the coding world. Why is it an interesting language? How is it different than Java? Why would one switch? For our next tech talk, we have invited Mariana Bocoi - a software developer at Volvo Car Mobility - who will try to answer these questions and share her experience from working in Java, Clojure and now Kotlin. Most of the comparisons will be to Java.

event.speaker: Martial Maillot
event.title: Lyon Kotlin User Group
event.subject: La programmation orienté objet en Kotlin
event.description: Livecoding pour découvrir les classes et extensions.

event.speaker: Nino Handler
event.title: GDG Nuremberg Android
event.subject: Kotlin - why, how, when - why?
event.description: Nino will give you reasons to switch to Kotlin if you haven't done yet and explain why it is nothing to be afraid of. A big part of the talk will be about interoperability between Kotlin and Java and how to call Kotlin code from Java.

event.speaker: Sergey Krukov, Kirill Rozov, Ruslan Ibragimov
event.title: School.kt
event.subject: Kotlin Ecosystem

event.speaker: Martial Maillot
event.title: Lyon Kotlin User Group
event.subject: Tests unitaires, une bonne recette
event.description:
Découverte : La programmation orienté objet en Kotlin : 20 minutes en livecoding pour découvrir la syntaxe et les outils proposés.

Confirmé : Tests unitaires, une bonne recette. Comment rendre vos tests unitaires plus lisible et concis avec Kotlin.

event.speaker: Andy Chow
event.title: Kotlin Waterloo P2P
event.subject: Testing with Kotlin
event.description: Andy will demonstrate how testing with Kotlin is significantly cleaner, easier and more enjoyable than Java. Testing can take advantage of the majority of Kotlin features and has some very easy to use frameworks. As a result, testing is one of the easiest ways to start making the switch from Java to Kotlin or to begin your Kotlin journey, so this is a must see talk!

event.speaker: Jendrik Johannes
event.title: Kotlin User Group Hamburg
event.subject: Dependency Management in Gradle 5 and beyond
event.description:
The Java ecosystem allows developers to profit from a large pool of reusable libraries. Traditionally, the platform-independence of Java always made it easy to publish and share ready-to-use libraries. As Kotlin and Android developers, we also profit from this existing catalogue of libraries. However, new challenges for dealing with dependencies in the JVM world emerged over the past years, as software systems grew further in complexity and new platforms, such as Kotlin or Android, emerged.

Dependency management is one of the major functionalities of the Gradle Build Tool.

Gradle 5 offers a number of new stable features to support developers in managing dependencies – and more can be expected soon.

event.speaker: Garth Gilmour
event.title: Kotlin Limerick User Group
event.subject: Kotlin - The Whole Damn Family
event.description: Kotlin has seen rapid adoption over the last two years, and is now mainstream on the JVM. But that is only the start of the story. During 2018 Kotlin JS became a realistic option for browser based apps, with extensive support for building UI's in React. This year will see the emergence of Kotlin Native, enabling you to write programs that run outside of the JVM across a range of platforms. Best of all your common code can be managed via multiplatform projects and libraries, ending the duplication of type declarations in distributed systems. In this talk Garth will present examples of both Kotlin JS Web apps and Kotlin Native programs and talk about the stability, maturity and long term prospects for each.

event.speaker: Alonso Torres
event.title: Madrid Groovy User Group
event.subject: Kotlin para Grooviers
event.description:
Google lo soporta como lenguaje de primer nivel para Android, muchas bibliotecas le dan soporte al primer nivel e incluso nuestro querido Gradle lo va a usar para implementar su DSL alternativa.

No es ningún secreto que Jetbrains, los creadores del lenguaje, se inspiraron muchísimo en Groovy. Eso nos coloca a los programadores de Groovy en un punto ideal porque con poco esfuerzo podemos aprender este nuevo lenguaje trayéndonos mucha experiencia.
